creator: pikapika2501@yahoo.com
text:
Our web production applcation is currently experiencing logging issues. Based on the frequency to whichh this happens is usually around thrice a year.

The nature to which this issue manifest can be described as our logFile being incomplete. Incomplete in a sense that a certain portion of our daily log is missing as describe below:


Also, it is worth to mention that we experience slow down with our application during the missing logs.

2010-02-15 20:30:24,869 INFO  [org.apache.catalina.startup.Embedded] Catalina naming disabled
2010-02-15 20:30:26,082 INFO  [org.apache.coyote.http11.Http11Protocol] Initializing Coyote HTTP/1.1 on http-0.0.0.0-8001
2010-02-15 20:30:26,085 INFO  [org.apache.catalina.startup.Catalina] Initialization processed in 1102 ms
2010-02-15 20:30:26,092 INFO  [org.apache.catalina.core.StandardEngine] Starting Servlet Engine: Apache Tomcat/5.5

2010-02-15 20:30:26,201 INFO  [org.apache.catalina.startup.Catalina] Server startup in 116 ms

We can see that our Application server is running on 3:43PM and no logs were generated 'till 8:30PM.
	3:43PM (An Exception incurred)
	<no logs... server is still active>
	8:30PM (The server restarted...)
	
As stated within this link http://logging.apache.org/log4j/1.2/faq.html#1.2ulk
We have a hinch that our application has the similar scenario wherein Log4j is currently being thrown a bulk number of things to log that resulted into a scenario that it wasn't able to write any, during those timeline.

Can you provide us with external links, probable explanation why this had happened, things to consider, things to modify or anything that could help us avoid, resolve or eliminate this?


Thanks in advance,

Frederick Gaetos
